items.sentence: Tom believes he knows what he's doing, but clearly he doesn't.
Tom and Mary carefully planned how they were going to do that.
I'm absolutely positive that it was Tom who stole your violin.
Tom knows a lot of people that don't know how to speak French.
That toilet brush belongs in the bathroom, not in the kitchen.
Power tends to corrupt and absolute power corrupts absolutely.
It was below zero this morning, but I cycled to school anyway.
What you make is small potatoes compared to the boss's salary.
If it hadn't been for the seatbelt, I wouldn't be alive today.
I just washed the dishes and now I have to take out the trash.
I haven't eaten all of the ice cream. There's still some left.
Tom told me he thought that Mary was the first one to do that.
I didn't mean to imply the work you're doing isn't worthwhile.
Among the guests invited to the party were two foreign ladies.
If you've finished reading the book, return it to the library.
Spending less than you earn is a good way to stay out of debt.
I wasn't very good at speaking French when I first moved here.
I'm going to try to persuade Tom to help us rebuild our porch.
I'm going to try to persuade Tom to carry my suitcases for me.
The old man sitting on the bench over there is my grandfather.
